programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day 11 of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes figure skating, curling, and ice hockey. The ice dance short figure skating event reaches a conclusion at Gangneung Ice Arena, while both the women's and men's Great Britain curling teams will be in action at Gangneung Curling Centre, as they face Japan and Norway in their latest respective round-robin matches. Meanwhile, the men's ice hockey competition continues with qualification play-off matches at Gangneung Hockey Centre, as teams attempt to progress to the quarter-finals

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents further coverage of the opening events on day 11 in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes figure skating, curling, and ice hockey

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather, with Dan Walker and Louise Minchin

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of the latest events on day 11 of the 23rd staging of the Games, including short track speed skating and bobsleigh. Elise Christie is set to be in action in the preliminary round of the women's 500m short track speed skating event, while her Team GB team-mates Mica McNeill and Mica Moore are in action in the heats of the women's bobsleigh. Also taking place in this session are biathlon, Nordic combined skiing and ice hockey

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Karen has an annoying itch which is affecting her work, Ayesha takes a huge risk for a young patient, and Sid struggles to help a difficult patient with anxiety

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: A death in custody brings Jane into contact with child killer Sidney Sutton and she hopes the case may help her to find the final resting place of his teenage victim

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in Dorset, where he helps a Queensland, Australia couple with a £450,000 budget make the move back to family roots in the UK

programme.title: Get Away for Winter
programme.desc: Dee and Celia want to leave the cold behind and spend part of the winter in Cyprus, so local property expert Julie is on hand to help

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: In Sunderland, Claire Rawle finds out about the Tynemouth Volunteer Life Brigade, and military fan Paul Laidlaw visits an Observation Post in Blyth

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Martin is keen to spend the day with his family, so he suggests that he and Stacey should take the children to watch a show at the community centre. But things soon fall apart when Stacey invites Kush along too. Vincent decides to sell Kim's ring - but he cannot find it anywhere - a hungover Tina wakes up to find she got a tattoo with a mystery man, and Bernadette takes the chess board home to practice - a plan that backfires when Bronson chomps down one of the pieces

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On her first night shift, a hungover Nicky must cope with an overbearing new registrar, while Fletch and Jac are thrust together on an overnight transplant case. Elsewhere, Oliver and Sheilagh are frustrated with being treated like children, so they team up to reclaim their dignity

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Perez is on the trail of an attacker, Tosh investigates Forst Energy in the search for Sally's killer, and DNA in the Kilmuir case yields a surprising result. Drama, starring Douglas Henshall

programme.title: Plastic Surgery Capital of the World
programme.desc: As a baby, Annie Price was badly burnt in a fire. She had life-saving operations on her face, but growing up her mum encouraged her to get on with her life rather than focusing on further plastic surgery. Now, aged 31 and about to get married, Annie is travelling to South Korea, where cosmetic surgery is so common people have double eyelid surgery and are back at work the next day

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents coverage of the opening events on day 12 in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes curling, alpine skiing, figure skating, and freestyle skiing. Great Britain's women's curling team participate in their final match of the round-robin stage as they take on Canada at Gangneung Curling Centre, while the ladies downhill alpine skiing is set to be decided at Jeongseon Alpine Centre. Elsewhere, the ladies single short dance figure skating event features at Gangneung Ice Arena, and the men's ski cross freestyle skiing event gets under way at Phoenix Snow Park

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Radzi Chinyanganya presents further coverage of day 12 in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes curling, alpine skiing, figure skating, and freestyle skiing

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather. Presented by Dan Walker and Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of the latest events on day 12 of the 23rd staging of the Games in PyeongChang, South Korea, including bobsleigh, cross-country skiing, and ice hockey. The women's bobsleigh continues at Olympic Sliding Centre with the running of the third heat. Canadian pilot Kaillie Humphries will be aiming to win a third consecutive Olympic title, while British hopes rest with Mica McNeill and Mica Moore. Elsewhere, medals are set to be decided in the men's team sprint cross-country skiing event, while the ice hockey competitions continue with more knockout-stage fixtures

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Heston has a surprise for Ruhma, but not everyone is happy about it. Elsewhere, Jimmi deals with two young Police Officers who accidentally crashed their car

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate when the patriarch of the local aristocratic family is found stabbed to death, but find themselves revisiting an embarrassing chapter of their teenage romance. Crime drama, Starring Claire Goose

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin heads to Sussex to help find a rural retreat for a couple with a budget of £650,000, and also visits Arundel Castle during a jousting tournament

programme.title: Get Away for Winter
programme.desc: Sally and Jan want to swap the cold of London for sunshine in Ibiza, and are shown four rental properties on the Spanish island by local property expert Hattie

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and Claire Rawle hunt for bargains in Scarborough, with finds including a pair of Charles Barlow vases, before heading to auction in Beverley, East Yorkshire

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vincent prepares for Pearl's birthday party but his mind is elsewhere when Aidan warns him he has until tomorrow to get the money. Martin contacts the solicitor but has a change of heart when Stacey apologises - unaware an email has already been sent to his wife. Tina is disappointed to learn Zsa Zsa did not trust her to look her to look after her pregnant friend Georgi, and Bernadette tries to retrieve the chess piece eaten by Bronson

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Richard Bilton sheds light on the difficulties faced by many private tenants in the UK, who have no long-term right to stay in their homes, and can be ordered to leave with little by the way of notice or explanation. Instances of what have come to be known as `no-fault evictions' are reported to have trebled in the last eight years, and Richard meets some of the people whose lives have been plunged into chaos by their landlords. He also investigates whether the implementation of new rules to protect tenants could cause the existing housing crisis to get even worse

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Focusing on the relationships between animals and people living in some of the world's most extraordinary natural wonders, this episode follows nomadic people from the Yamal Peninsula in northern Siberia, as they hunt one of the very few animals that can survive in this frozen environment, reindeer. Elsewhere, cameras observe a local ranger in the coastal salt marshes of Northern Australia's Arnhem Land, as he goes in search of the eggs of one of the world's most aggressive predators, the saltwater crocodile

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic rowing champion Helen Glover, former England rugby union international Rob Andrew, Commonwealth badminton gold medallist Gail Emms and Great Britain sprint hurdles great Colin Jackson join regular team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker on the quiz

programme.title: And They're Off for Sport Relief
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Tyger Drew-Honey, Sharron Davies, Sam Quek and Zoe Lyons all put their athleticism to the test, as Ore Oduba presents one last round of the sporting challenge. As ever, the celebrity contestants are tasked with competing in a series of bizarre races, while members of the public answer general knowledge questions and try to predict which of them will win. Last in the series

programme.title: Odyssey
programme.desc: After seeing Aslam's picture on Shakir Kahn's television programme, Odelle is finally reunited with her young friend. Maya's relationship with Cameron deepens, worrying Peter who believes that the object of her affections is a Societel Mining spy. Still hot on his father's trail, Harrison makes enquiries about a story his father left unfinished. Thriller, starring Anna Friel, Peter Facinelli and Jake Robinson

programme.title: Odyssey
programme.desc: Odelle tries to get a message to a reporter based in Paris through Shakir, but it is intercepted by Majors. Peter leads two hackers into the SOC mainframe so they can recover the evidence concerning Sophia Tsaldari, Harrison's investigation into Qasim results in him being arrested, and Ron discovers the army has been falsifying evidence, leading him to suspect his wife is still alive

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Matt Baker visit Cambridgeshire, where a project is underway to turn a quarry into a safe reed bed habitat for one of the UK's rarest birds, the bittern. Richard Taylor-Jones witnesses a spectacular display of wildlife, Adam Henson meets a young farmer in the New Forest, and Tom Heap discovers how Bill gates is making the most of British agricultural expertise

programme.title: Shane: For the Love of the Game
programme.desc: Documentary following Shane Williams as he attempts to build a life after rugby, going to work with the family firm and trying out other sports - and finding the more he tries to get away from the game, the more it gradually pulls him back onto the pitch

programme.title: Hugh's Wild West
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall continues his wildlife expedition in the West Country, turning his attention to the curious creatures of the Jurassic Coast, and the local conservationists dedicated to their care. Resident fishermen help Hugh devise a plan to witness the odd behaviour of cuttlefish up-close, and on the shingle expanse of Chesil Beach, a team of volunteers works to ensure nesting terns are able to raise their young in safety

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates more food served to monarchs, beginning by helping chef Paul Ainsworth to prepare an exotic dessert. Mich Turner recreates a birthday cake

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day 11 of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes curling and ice hockey. The women's British curling team will be in action this morning as they take on Japan in their 10th round-robin encounter at Gangneung Curling Centre. Meanwhile, the men's ice hockey competition has reached the knockout stage, and qualification play-off matches are scheduled to take place at Gangneung Hockey Centre, with the winners progressing to the quarter-finals

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At Longleat Safari Park, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover how a reluctant rhino is encouraged to take a mud bath, and cameras follow the arrival of lethal tarantulas

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts, along with former footballer Dion Dublin, explore properties in Birmingham, Oldham in Greater Manchester and Gravesend in Kent. They then speak to the new owners about how much they paid for them at auction, and discuss their plans for the buildings

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Colin Young and David Harper offer advice to two teams of female contestants in Shrewsbury, where they hunt for collectibles to sell at auction. Presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Nunnington Hall in North Yorkshire to explore the legacy of a First World War trenches officer

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present coverage of the latest events on day 11 of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including curling, bobsleigh, Nordic combined skiing, and ice hockey. The round-robin stage of the curling competition continues today, with the British teams engaged in their 10th match to date, as the women face Japan and the men battle against Norway at Gangneung Curling Centre. Elsewhere, the first and second heats of the women's bobsleigh are scheduled for Alpensia Sliding Centre, the men's team competition in the Nordic combined event is due to be completed, and the ice hockey competitions continue with the play-offs in the men's tournament, and fifth- and seventh-place classification games for the women

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores a Swiss garden in Bedfordshire, drives a `locomobile', and at Rothampsted, he discovers the Victorian origins of the fertiliser industry

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the 11th day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. Today saw gold medals awarded in a variety of events including biathlon, freestyle skiing, figure skating, Nordic combined and short track speed skating, while the round-robin stage of the women's and men's curling competition continued with the 10th round of matches

programme.title: Back in Time for Tea
programme.desc: The Ellis family enjoys the new freedoms of the 1960s, from steak and chips and caravan holidays to muscle man competitions. Cameras follow dad as he puts in a shift down the local pit, while mum and girls head to the local phone box to try the new telephone recipe service. Presented by Sara Cox and Polly Russell

programme.title: Flatpack Empire
programme.desc: Cameras follow Mia Lundstrom as she takes on the company's biggest challenge in a generation - pushing into India with an aggressive expansion plan. Not only is IKEA bringing their stores and products, but their unique culture and values. Meanwhile, staff at a Wembley branch create room-sets that better reflect a changing world. Last in the series

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: New series. The comedy returns to follow another year in the life of the widow, her family and friends. It is Cathy's 60th birthday and the family are going to lunch. Starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: The Archiveologists
programme.desc: New series. Comedy performers Diane Morgan and Joe Wilkinson, also known as Two Episodes of Mash, launch a series of spoofs by parodying a 1970s documentary about Luton Library

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Generation Gifted
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following children from low income families over three critical years, exploring the challenges they face as they progress from ages 13 to 16. The first episode follows three young girls as they face the mounting pressure of their first year of GCSE preparation. In Port Talbot, avid reader Anne-Marie knows she wants to go to university, but needs help dealing with the prospect of exams. Meanwhile in Tamworth, Shakira's school try to help her find her creative voice by pushing her out of her comfort zone, and aspiring paediatrician Jada from Birmingham is determined to ace her Year 9 exams, as she hopes to secure her place at a nearby Sixth Form grammar school

programme.title: Generation Gifted
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries about children from low income families meets three bright 13-year-old boys facing many uncertainties. Kian from Hartlepool is a bright mathematician but worries about the future and feels pressure both at home and at school. Liam from Newcastle is on track to gain top science grades at GCSE but his teachers believe he is limiting his aspirations, while in London, problems at home threaten to derail talented student Jamarley. The producers will return to catch up with the children in two years' time. Narrated by Maxine Peake

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the latest round of fixtures, featuring Hull Kingston Rovers v Catalan Dragons, and Widnes Vikings v Warrington Wolves(c)

programme.title: The New Builds Are Coming: Battle in the Countryside
programme.desc: Richard Macer heads to Oxfordshire, one of the most expensive counties in the country, to investigate if building estates across the British countryside can help the UK's struggling housing market, with remarkable access to councillors, developers, architects and campaigners. In the second episode, Richard meets the architects and developers who are changing the face of rural Britain, the people trying to create a community from scratch, and the pioneers making these new Utopias their homes(c)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Paralympians and gold medal winners Danny Crates and Liz Johnson shop their way around Suffolk and Essex buying up items to take to auction in Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire. Experts David Harper and Arusha Irvine are on hand to help(c)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk and Anna Haugh create an Edwardian full English breakfast, Dr Polly Russell leafs through precious recipe books, and Carolyn Robb bakes Prince Charles' favourite loaf(c)

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents coverage of the latest events on day 12 of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, which includes curling and ice hockey. The men's British curling team will engage in their final match of the round-robin stage as they face USA at Gangneung Curling Centre, while the knockout stages of the ice hockey competitions continue with the women's bronze-medal match, as well as the men's quarter-finals

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers are taken by surprise with the unexpected birth of a sea lion pup, while one of the park's best known giraffes has become very sick, and vets cannot work out why

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin view properties in Stoke-on-Trent, Croydon in south London and Warrington in Greater Manchester, before finding out who bought them

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A recently engaged couple compete in Grimsthorpe, Lincolnshire, against a husband and wife who have been married for 43 years. Antiques experts Mark Stacey and David Harper assist the teams in their search, while presenter Tim Wonnacott visits Grimsthorpe Castle

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: The day's political news, interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics 2018
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Hazel Irvine present coverage of the latest events on day 12 of the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea, including bobsleigh and speed skating. The women's bobsleigh is scheduled to come to a conclusion at Olympic Sliding Centre with the fourth and final heat. Meanwhile, medals are also set to be decided in the men's and women's team pursuit speed skating events, which takes place at Gangneung Oval

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Newark-on-Trent to Stockton-on-Tees, and a scandalous novel written in Thirsk leads him to a wildlife centre, where he feeds a hungry hedgehog

programme.title: Winter Olympics - Today at the Games
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the 12th day's action from the 23rd staging of the Games, which takes place in PyeongChang, South Korea. Today saw the conclusion of the women's bobsleigh, in which British duo Mica McNeill and Mica Moore were looking to impress, while medals were also decided in alpine skiing, speed skating, cross-country skiing, and snowboarding events

programme.title: Tom Kerridge: Lose Weight for Good
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the chef takes the group of dieters on a river cruise to celebrate their weight loss over the past 12 weeks. Tom prepares a selection of sharing dishes for the special occasion, including couscous, griddled halloumi and Mediterranean vegetables, pulled pork tacos with salad, and falafels with a tzatziki dip. Last in the series

programme.title: Trust Me, I'm a Doctor
programme.desc: Medical journalist Michael Mosley teams up with Olympic athletes to test which types of exercise promote stronger bone development, and geneticist Dr Giles Yeo offers health tips to people whose body clocks are out of sync with their working day. GP Dr Zoe Williams looks into which health advice on the internet can be trusted, and surgeon Gabriel Weston carries out an experiment to discover if cleaning homes with antibacterial products could be responsible for the rise in allergies and asthma. Last in the series

programme.title: Murdered for Love? Samia Shahid
programme.desc: On July 14, 2016, Bradford woman Samia Shahid flew to Pakistan to visit her family. Six days later, the 28-year-old was found dead. This documentary tells the story of Samia's life, how her arranged marriage to her cousin broke down, and the arrest of her first husband and her father in connection with her murder

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James and Ellie Taylor join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Matt Allwright presents an appeal on behalf of Together for Short Lives, a charity providing support for families of children with life-shortening conditions

programme.title: Flatpack Empire
programme.desc: Cameras follow Mia Lundstrom as she takes on the company's biggest challenge in a generation - pushing into India with an aggressive expansion plan. Not only is IKEA bringing their stores and products, but their unique culture and values. Meanwhile, staff at a Wembley branch create room-sets that better reflect a changing world. Last in the series

programme.title: Police Tapes: The Murder of Becky Watts
programme.desc: When 16-year-old Becky Watts went missing in 2015, it sparked a major police investigation to find the teenager. But only two people knew where she was - her stepbrother Nathan and his girlfriend Shauna. Here, Susanna Reid gains unprecedented access to police interview room footage to reveal the strategy and skill involved in catching Becky's killers. There is also first-person testimony from some of the officers, and Susanna talks to Becky's family about the impact of this appalling crime

programme.title: Jackpot247
programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Maya Jama discusses the BRITs, and addresses rumours that she and shortlisted artist Stormzy are set to marry

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby talk to The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel star Celia Imrie about her new film, Finding Your Feet. Including Local Weather

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef begins the Texan leg of his journey in San Antonio, a city which was once part of Mexico. Here, James samples traditional tamales and barbecoa at the hands of the city's most famous chef, Johnny Hernandez. The chef also tries authentic street food in the form of hot, fresh chorros, and learns about the famous San Antonio Chilli Queens

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five drag queens from London answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Jason, Brad, Kathryn and Jennifer pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Phil blackmails Tracy, revealing that he has footage of the two of them together which he will show David unless she agrees to pay him off - one way or another. Ross tells Pete and Debbie that he is determined to find out who attacked him, and Lachlan is consumed with guilt

programme.title: 100 Year Old Driving School
programme.desc: Return of the documentary focusing on seasoned drivers. They include 102-year-old veteran Royal Navy Officer John Errol Manners, who has cheated death three times before. Examiners from the Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents assess his driving skills, as well as 91-year-old Joan Beech

programme.title: What Would Your Kid Do
programme.desc: Children are filmed in a school specially rigged with hidden cameras. In the studio, host Jason Manford challenges parents to predict what their child will do in each situation, providing an insight into the developing minds of five to seven year-olds. The family with the most correct predictions goes through to the final. And the kids choose the prizes

programme.title: Benidorm: Ten Years on Holiday
programme.desc: First screened in 2007 in a 30-minute format, the sitcom Benidorm has become an award-winning favourite for millions of viewers. The show's creator and writer Derren Litten reveals how the show was created, and cast members including Steve Pemberton and Siobhan Finneran talk about their roles on the series

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Comedian Paddy McGuinness, actress, model and singer Catherine Tyldesley and footballer-turned-pundit Chris Kamara form the celebrity panel, as Keith Lemon ventures into the homes of three more mystery stars. Once inside, the presenter points out telltale clues that might hint at the identity of each property's occupant, and challenges his studio panellists to guess `who habitates in a house like this?'

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: A rower from Nottingham, a barman from Luton, a lifeguard from London and a football fan from Ipswich enter the `love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Host Paddy McGuinness presides on the matching process, and also catches up on the latest dating action from all the couples in Fernando's as the dating game bows out for another series. Last in the series

programme.desc: Viewers are offered the chance to participate in live interactive gaming from the comfort of their sofas, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Aljaz Skorjanec and Janette Manrara are in the studio ahead of their tour, Remembering Fred, and also discuss being so busy that they have not had the time to take a honeymoon after their wedding last year. Presented by Susanna Reid and Kate Garraway

programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby present celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in Austin as he continues his culinary journey through Texas, where he samples vegan barbecue food from one of Austin's most famous food trucks, and cooks recipes using locally sourced ingredients. James also meets Austin native and musician Jackie Venson, to find out why the city is known as America's live music capital

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of school friends from Kent answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Fiona, Omeed, Jill and Michael pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Tracy arranges to meet Phil at a hotel, unaware that a suspicious David has decided to follow her. Ross vents his frustrations, and Aaron tells Alex he can move into Mill Cottage - leaving Robert devastated

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen is surprised by the turnaround in Billy and quizzes him about his apparent speedy recovery from the painkiller withdrawal. Johnny assures Roy that he will take care of Carla while the cafe owner is looking after his mother, and Phelan makes a copy of Nicola's flat keys without her knowing

programme.title: The BRIT Awards 2018
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall hosts the 38th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop music awards, staged at London's O2, and featuring performances by some of the biggest names in the music industry, including Justin Timberlake, Ed Sheeran, Foo Fighters, Dua Lipa, Rita Ora, Stormzy and Rag'n'Bone Man

programme.title: UEFA Champions League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from tonight's last-16 first-leg matches, which were Sevilla v Manchester United at Estadio Ramon Sanchez Pizjuan, and Shakhtar Donetsk v AS Roma at Metalist Stadium in Karkiv. Plus a look back at Chelsea v Barcelona, and Bayern Munich v Besiktas, both of which took place last night. Presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Roy Keane and Lee Dixon, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley, Sam Matterface and Joe Speight

programme.title: The £1 Houses: Britain's Cheapest Street
programme.desc: New series. Following the work of buyers in Liverpool transforming derelict houses bought for just £1, as they gamble their savings to try and step onto the property ladder. The first episode follows childhood sweethearts Mel and Rob, who are desperate to give their children a home through sheer hard graft and a tiny budget, but a local shooting makes them question their decision. Elsewhere, the programme follows the work of Rachael and Sam, who transform a derelict wreck into a stunning three bed home, and post-graduate Victoria, who remains endlessly optimistic in the face of adversity

programme.title: The Job Interview
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following an assortment of jobseekers as they interview for real-life positions. Virgin Trains recruitment duo Diego and Kathryn are looking for someone to bring sparkle to the role of serving drinks and snacks on the West Coast Main Line, while at cosmetics brand Ciate London, founder Charlotte and marketing director Caroline want someone to boost their online promotion

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Country House Cleaners
programme.desc: Cleaning obsessives Hayley and Dann head for Plas Teg, a 17th-century Jacobean manor in the heart of Flintshire, north Wales. This 10-bedroom Italian-inspired residence is home to Cornelia and her 12 cats, and is also said to be one of the most haunted houses in Wales. Cornelia is desperate to generate income to restore the Grade I listed building to its former glory, so Hayley and Dann have agreed to spend five days cleaning alongside her, pushing their boundaries and challenging their germ phobia

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Women's Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier who's more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although they're apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie

programme.title: Four Rooms with Sarah Beeny
programme.desc: Dealers Celia Sawyer, Raj Bisram, Alex Proud and David Sonnenthal lock horns over an antique antler inkwell and marvel at a massive festival mask from Nepal. A very rare book by Mary Wollstonecraft and William Blake makes an impression, as does an artwork of several famous `bronze fingers'

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers in London. The programme's youngest-ever house-hunter, 18-year-old student Claire Winship, has had cerebral palsy from birth and uses a wheelchair. With a budget of £1.7million, she wants a property with good investment potential, plenty of accessible space and a view of the Thames. Meanwhile, trainee fashion buyer Geri and her carpenter boyfriend Arran are looking for a one-bedroom flat near Crouch End in north London, and have £280,000 to spend

programme.title: Superfoods: The Real Story
programme.desc: Kate Quilton is in India to find out if turmeric helped her recovery from a serious back injury. She also investigates whether kids' party favourite jelly could be paving the way to better bones, and if eggs really are good for your eyes

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with actor and impressionist Alistair McGowan in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary's investigation jeopardises the aliens' mission, Don disappoints Sally and the Big Giant Head brings bad news

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.sub-title: The Thing That Wouldn't Die - Part Two.
programme.desc: Last-ever episode. With their mission over, the aliens prepare to leave Earth - but Dick finds himself unable to abandon Mary and wonders if she might join him in outer space. John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Kristen Johnston star

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray thinks a family portrait would make the perfect Christmas present for his parents, but does not count on it causing an argument about who should be in the picture. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra have very different opinions on how to react to the news that Ally has been bullying another child on the school bus. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A workmate agrees to teach Frasier enough Hebrew to deliver the speech at his son Frederick's bar mitzvah, but the arrangement ends in double-dealing and mutual recrimination. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: In the first of a three-part story, Frasier struggles to replace Daphne and ends up hiring a woman who proves to be completely unsuitable. Meanwhile, Niles experiences an amazing chain of events, including winning the same competition twice and having his car struck by lightning

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part two of three. While Niles waits to undergo his heart bypass operation, Frasier tries to keep everyone's spirits up by describing the procedure in detail - a brainwave that leaves Daphne more depressed than ever. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Karen Freeman-Wilson, the Mayor of Gary, Indiana, dons a disguise to go incognito among the city's workforce - including a sanitation plant operator and a fire fighter

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The dinner-party challenge heads to Liverpool as four contestants compete to win the prize money. First to host is educational doll distributor Jane Gordon, who attempts to take control of her guests and ensure the focus stays on herself. Next it's the turn of communications manager Les Rushford, who tries to initiate serious conversation alongside his GMO-free menu before student Becci Weir cooks up a Spanish fiesta and barber Barry Hayden channels a Greek theme

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south east London, Nathan and Debs try to do deals on a kit car and some fairground swing boats

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Alastair Stewart is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman tries to help Dave and Debbie Gough from Swindon, who have been holidaying on the Costa Blanca for 30 years and now want to retire there

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A new restaurant in Spain tries to meet the opening deadline, and two gite owners in France give up their cosy home to live in a barn

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: Suzanne attempts an Elvis-inspired jukebox cake, and Molly creates a white winter wonderland masterpiece for a 30th birthday party

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: School bully Jimbo orders Bart to entertain his girlfriend Shauna, so he takes her to the cinema. But before he knows it, he's fallen for the girl and chaperoning turns to canoodling. Homer needs to shift the pounds but it's a struggle for him to leave his beloved sofa - until a treadmill with a built-in TV provides all the motivation he needs

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Jack receives some life-threatening news, Jesse has a decision to make, and Adam gets the wrong end of the stick about his father when he sees him with another woman

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Joe Wicks: The Body Coach
programme.desc: Part two of two. The health guru meets four people determined to overhaul their health, lifestyles and bodies. They include pub landlords Jim and Helen, a couple who want to put an end to long hours and late-night takeaways

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zach, who's 25, is rushed to A&E after completely severing four fingers in a building site accident. Staff and plastic surgeons assess the damage and stem the bloody wound. Cameras also follow former teacher Ricky, who's 85. She has hurt her back after falling at home, and 10-year-old Daquon was hit by a motorbike when he was on his way to school. He has memory loss and a badly broken arm

programme.title: Working with Weinstein
programme.desc: Under criminal investigation in Britain and the US, expelled from Bafta and the Academy of Motion Pictures, Harvey Weinstein's fall from grace has been swift since allegations of sexual abuse and harassment emerged against him last October. This documentary hears testimony from those who worked with him across 30 years of British film, and investigates how he kept his accusers quiet for decades

programme.title: Before We Die
programme.desc: Now that Hanna knows her own son is `Inez', the police infiltrator within the Mimica crime family, she wants to get him out immediately and close the investigation. To Hanna's despair, Christian chooses to continue, despite the risk. Swedish thriller, starring Marie Richardson. In Swedish

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character

programme.title: World of Weird
programme.desc: Joel Dommett visits Tokyo to lend his services to a `crying agency', which dispatches attractive men to businesses to help traditionally reserved Japanese workers liberate their emotions in group-crying sessions. In Glasgow, Meryl Fernandes meets `sploshing' fetishists who get a thrill out of being covered in food and `gunk'. Back in Japan, the team covers a penis festival, in which women ride an enormous wooden phallus down to local hot springs in the hope of increasing their fertility. Finally, Ben Shires heads to the USA, where he meets Boomer, a man who identifies as a dog

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman who suffers from nocturnal epileptic fits brings in Pearl, a Staffordshire bull terrier that can sense when its episodes are about to happen. However, the dog has problems with its knees and struggles to walk, so the pressure is on for Noel Fitzpatrick to restore it back to full health. Plus, an Irish setter has a cancerous tumour in its front leg, and a cat needs its jaw wiring back together after being hit by a car

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Quiz in which seven contestants are locked in a jury room and must work together to answer questions correctly and accumulate as much money as possible. However, only one of them can leave with each day's prize fund

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A Bedfordshire-based duo make plans to return to Scotland, with help from Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi. They hope to find Brian and Marjory the perfect home for their £400,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Aberdeenshire couple Karen and Russell, discovering they are not living in the property she found for them, but instead inhabiting a place they could never have imagined possible. programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps transform Emma and Darren's Worcester home - which seems to be stuck in a 1980s time warp - revamping an old kitchen and a sitting and dining room that has seen better days

programme.title: Countdown

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The four aliens land on Earth and assume human forms, and Dick soon finds himself attracted to a college professor with whom he shares an office. First-ever episode of the award-winning comedy, starring John Lithgow, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Kristen Johnston and French Stewart

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: The aliens catch a cold from Tommy, just as Dick is about to escort Dr Albright to a wedding. Sci-fi comedy, guest starring Martha Stewart, with John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Joseph Gordon-Levitt

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The family begins to criticise Ray for not attending Sunday Mass like his father Frank, prompting him to become a regular churchgoer. Charles Durning guest stars alongside Ray Romano and Peter Boyle

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert is injured in the line of duty and Ray realises he is partly responsible. Unfortunately his bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired, until he grudgingly agrees to Debra's demand to tell his brother how much he cares for him. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Brad Garrett and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part three of three. As Niles continues to recover from open-heart surgery, he masks his fear of death with overconfidence and an elaborate show of zest for life. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: As the Christmas season draws near, Frasier is furious to learn that Daphne and Niles want to host the family get-together, prompting a feud between the brothers. Meanwhile, Roz finds herself falling for a department store Santa Claus. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The brothers visit a luxury spa, where they are astonished to discover they are not enjoying the highest level of service and try to sneak into an area reserved exclusively for its most valued members. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Scott, CEO of clothing retailer New York & Company, disguises himself to go undercover among his own employees seeking ways to keep the business in vogue and increase profitability. He meets up with a sales associate, a fitting room stylist, a stocker and an assistant manager

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Four contestants from in and around Liverpool compete to host the best dinner party and win the £1,000 prize. First up is shop owner Sally who hopes to impress with her vintage-themed Italian night, while mortgage advisor Gareth aims to provoke a debate with his choice of unusual meats. The third evening features a seafood-inspired menu, while final host Cindy offers the diners some home comforts

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Larry and Neil at Cashbrokers in Penzance look at an unusual red telephone box, and try to raise enough money on a Formula One memorabilia collection to keep someone's racing dreams alive. In London, Nathan and his assistant Debs have a close shave when valuing a mobile hairdressers and set about solving the mystery of an unusual handbag

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with Alastair Stewart in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sun-worshippers Carol and Junior Smith from Middlesex have cashed in their savings and cannot wait to buy a holiday home where they can spend more quality time as a family. With a budget of £70,000, Jonnie Irwin shows them five properties near the popular Mar Menor in the south-east of Spain. Will they go for a bungalow with a rooftop terrace or a spacious townhouse that has them lost for words?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A nest of bees threatens to hamper building works in the Dordogne, and a young British couple open their glamping site in France

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where the hosts playful approach leaves their guests questioning their business credentials

programme.title: Extreme Cake Makers
programme.desc: London baker Nastassja creates an elephant christening cake, and a wedding cake reflects a couples' unusual tale of love on the high seas

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: A Totally Fun Thing That Bart Will Never Do Again.
programme.desc: Bart persuades his family to go on a cruise, and for once the Simpsons enjoy their holiday - Lisa bonds with other intelligent children while Marge and Homer get some rare time alone. But when Bart embarks on an inspired yet morally dubious plan to prolong the trip indefinitely, things take a turn for the worse. With the guest voices of Steve Coogan and Treat Williams

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane and Cindy clash over their children, Jesse prepares for his drugs trial, whilst Glenn lies to Adam about the mystery woman in his truck

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Sabrina Grant present money-saving tips and reveal tricks of the retail trade, including a web of online reviews that you cannot necessarily trust. Elsewhere in the programme, a supermarket price check reveals the surprising cost of convenience, and ways to save money on pampering your pets

programme.title: The £1 Houses: Britain's Cheapest Street
programme.desc: The documentary series following the work of buyers in Liverpool transforming derelict houses bought for just £1 continues. In the second episode, the renovation scheme hits a crisis, as a frustrated Victoria decides to move in before the council have signed off on her house, and a nearby shooting spooks young parent Mel. Meanwhile, local shopkeepers Mo and Eman's house is ransacked, and things comes to a head as anger erupts at a meeting between the council and the new residents

programme.title: Damned
programme.desc: Al gets a surprise visit from Sean, a boy with a transitioning parent and a troubled past, while Denise's brother Dennis visits and takes a shine to Rose, much to Denise's fury. Elsewhere, the ever-competitive Nitin cannot seem to get over the fact that Martin is Mimi's mentor, and Ingrid is excited about welcoming her 14 year-old foster son, but things do go to quite as she had planned. Starring Jo Brand, Alan Davies, Kevin Eldon, Georgie Glen, Himesh Patel, Isy Suttie and Lolly Adefope

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Alex Horne and the Horne Section join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the letters and numbers

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zach, who's 25, is rushed to A&E after completely severing four fingers in a building site accident. Staff and plastic surgeons assess the damage and stem the bloody wound. Cameras also follow former teacher Ricky, who's 85. She has hurt her back after falling at home, and 10-year-old Daquon was hit by a motorbike when he was on his way to school. He has memory loss and a badly broken arm

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

In the opening edition, she and her fellow passengers stop off in Nassau in the Bahamas, where Jane finds solace in the state's oldest baptist church, and St Martin, where she seeks an intimate underwater audience with a host of sharks. Back on board, Jane is startled by the scale of everything - from the food and activities to the sheer number of people

programme.title: House Doctor

The lurid wall colours and pink living room carpet are banished, leaving pine floorboards that help create a sense of the outdoors

programme.title: Divine Designs

He then views more pre-Reformation treasures in Ranworth, Norfolk, where the church has a finely painted rood-screen and an altar dedicated to women

programme.title: Wildlife SOS

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Chris Peace diagnoses a fitness fanatic with a fungal infection after she notices an unusual red patch on her leg has spread to her thighs. Meanwhile, Dr Marietta Swanne suspects an elderly patient's own livid breakout could be caused by cellulitis. Across the corridor, Dr Joanna Brigg also deals with a skin disorder, this time in the form of a full body rash she believes could be a symptom of pityiasis rosea, a non-contagious condition that can last up to six weeks

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In West London, agents Max and Cona chase up more than £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, but when they try to seize a vehicle, the debtor ties it to a tree. Meanwhile in Lancashire, officers Stewart and Elmor try to collect £4,000 owed for unpaid nursery fees, and in Bedfordshire two agents must tackle a church ministry that owes over £8,000 in rent arrears

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay residents

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Susan remains suspicious about the real reason for Izzy's return and enlists Dipi's help in her search for answers. Mark's brothers urge him to patch things up with Paige

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: NCIS: Conspiracy to Murder: Judgement Day - Part One.
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, the entire team is put in danger while hunting for the killer of a former NCIS agent. Jenny Shepard calls in Mike Franks for help, afraid she too is a target - and convinced Gibbs will be next. American crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Deadly Departure
programme.desc: The family of FBI agent Sarah Plummer are taken hostage while she is on a flight to Washington, DC. While on the flight, she meets a mysterious stranger seated beside her, and is forced to make a decision that could cost her the lives of her husband and 12-year-old son. Action, starring Dina Meyer, Victoria Pratt and Justin Johnson

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.title: 5 News Tonight

programme.title: FIA World Rally Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The Rally Sweden. Action from the second round of the season, which took place on road surfaces covered in snow around Torsby. Reigning champion Sebastien Ogier entered this event at the top of the standings following his victory in Monte Carlo last time out

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.sub-title: The Dog Rescuers Special: 21 Dogs - The Big Rescue.
programme.desc: New series. Return of the documentary profiling RSPCA officers, including Sarah Gardener, who enters one of the largest multi-dog households ever seen. Cameras also follow Anthony Pulfer, who attempts to help six dogs caught in a house fire in south east London, and there's a happy ending for two dogs left in the lurch by their owner

programme.title: Elizabeth: Our Queen
programme.desc: A look at Elizabeth II's life in the 1950s and 1960s, how she tried to make the monarchy more accessible, and the lesson she learned from the 1966 Aberfan disaster. William Heseltine also reveals how, as her Press Secretary, he tried to make the Queen more approachable to the media

programme.title: Ben Fogle: Return to the Wild
programme.desc: Ben Fogle returns to Texas to catch up with former fashion photographer John Wells, who decided to give up his life in New York City to move to a remote desert home. Five years on from their first meeting, Ben discovers how a serious accident almost cost John everything, and the impact the accident has on his home in the scorching Texan desert

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Underground
programme.desc: Geologist Tom Backhouse investigates sinkholes caused by collapsed mine shafts, including one in Gosforth that opened up in front of a flat and led down to an abandoned coal mine. In Bury St Edmunds, a homeowner reveals how he is stuck in an unsellable house that is surrounded by sinkholes

programme.title: Weather Terror: Brits in Peril
programme.sub-title: Weather Terror: Eye of the Storm.
programme.desc: The story of a heroic cruise ship entertainer, who took charge when the vessel began to sink and the captain was nowhere to be found, leading to 571 passengers being saved. Plus, a small tropical storm that turned into a category-five cyclone, two people who braved a firestorm in the Costa del Sol to save three horses, a landslide in Austria and a snowboarder who got caught in an avalanche in New Zealand

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Sara Kayat meets Daya, a young man who has been experiencing trouble with his feet for the past four years. He has what appears to be a fungal infection under his toenails, so Dr Sara takes some clippings to send off for analysis. Her next patient is Anna, who has been driven to distraction by itchy feet, caused by athlete's foot and pustular psoriasis. Plus, Dr William Laird takes the surgery's third foot patient, this time taking the form of schoolboy Jack, who sprained his ankle during enthusiastic performances on the squash and volleyball courts

programme.title: Cruising with Jane McDonald
programme.desc: A Lilliputian lope round the Inner Hebrides puts Jane in touch with her Scottish roots, as alongside just six other passengers the singer embarks on what is easily her smallest ever cruise. Jane enjoys unseasonably cloudless skies and sparkling seas as the route takes in the puffin-packed Treshnish Islands and Fingal's Cave on Staffa, the mythic rock formation that famously inspired Mendelssohn's Hebrides Overture. The excursion is rounded off with some traditional trappings, from ceilidhs and weaving to haggis-making

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice visits Essex to offer advice to a Colchester couple unable to snap up their dream home until they can sell their current house. Unfortunately, after four months on the market, there is still no buyer for the three-bedroom detached property - which comes complete with a wild colour scheme

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski chronicles the development of religious architecture during the 16th and 17th centuries. He contrasts the ornate splendour of the chapel at King's College, Cambridge, with the simplicity of post-Reformation churches

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: The owls are determined to see the solar eclipse today, and need Oona and Baba to help them stay awake. But after a night's hunting, they are very sleepy

programme.title: Poppy Cat
programme.desc: Mo finds a giant toothbrush on the ground and decides it must have come from a whale, so he sets out to the sea to find its owner

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon's older cousin and his friend tell Simon and Lou that they are too little to join in their game of football

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: While Bob and the team are building an aqueduct between Spring City and Fixham, a group of ducklings mistake Muck for their real mother

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mike is called to fix Norman's mess when he overloads the washing machine, unaware that he has committed an equally dangerous mistake by leaving his iron unattended

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Edward shows his friend Charlie that he has a more light-hearted side, but his antics cause problems when he accidentally delivers the Fat Controller's car to the steam works

programme.title: The Secret Life of Puppies
programme.desc: Five new mothers look after their two-week old pups, feeding and care for their little ones who are all born deaf, blind and extremely hungry

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the Paw Patrol need to fix the lighthouse so they can save Cap'n Turbot, who is stuck in thick fog

programme.desc: The children visit a farm to find out where milk comes from

programme.desc: Kerry's birthday arrives, but he thinks that nobody has remembered

programme.desc: Part two of two. Vance sticks rigidly to the rules as he investigates the death of a fellow agent, but Gibbs and Franks take matters into their own hands to catch the killers. The case also leads to major changes for the agency. Drama, starring Rocky Carroll, Mark Harmon and Muse Watson

programme.desc: A student fears for her life after a number of disturbing occurrences, leaving her desperately searching for the culprit. programme.title: The Nightmare Neighbour Next Door
programme.desc: A woman living in Slough becomes embroiled in a dispute with a neighbour, certain that he is behind recent damage to her car and stones thrown at her window. Meanwhile, couple Manny and Sianna living in Hereford are forced to call the police after complaining about their neighbours Gail and Gordon's four dogs. But things go from bad to worse as Gordon and Manny end up fighting in the garden

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Farida Ahmad is confronted by a man suffering with tonsillitis who has been vomiting. Urgent care clinician Lizzie treats 12-year-old Naomi, who has a mysterious pea-sized nodule on her cheek. Lizzie is stumped, so calls in Dr Jane Edge for another opinion. Dr Andy Cordell's patient Ray has a strange scaly growth on his upper arm. It gives the GP cause for concern, so he refers Ray to the cancer clinic for an urgent appointment

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away: Final Demand.
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. The series follows each case as it unfolds, recording the thoughts and feelings on both sides, the process of repossession and the impact it has on all involved

programme.title: Undercover: Nailing the Fraudsters
programme.desc: New series. Paul Connolly investigates phishing, a multi-million-pound enterprise that involves fraudsters trying to get people to hand over their personal bank details. As part of his investigation, Paul reveals the gang who stole £113 million over three years and also tracks down one of the UK's biggest phishing fraudsters, who manages to ?earn' up to £100,000 a week

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: Trainee accountant Stuart Harling was obsessed with an ultraviolent video game, and in 2006 killed nurse Cheryl Moss by stabbing her 72 times. A-level student Steven Miles watched nothing but crime drama Dexter, and in 2014 dismembered his girlfriend. Aaron Roach Bridgeman talks with experts associated with the cases, contemplating whether any connection can be proven between entertainment and actions

programme.desc: It is 1939, and Newcastle shipyard worker Joe Maddison feels past his prime - too old to serve in the war alongside his son, who is beginning his RAF training. A few days later, when his wife leaves him for a young naval officer, Joe finds himself without purpose and in need of a new challenge - so he and best friend Harry decide to join the Home Guard. The decision is one that leads him on a journey of self-discovery and teaches him lessons in heroism, friendship and love. Feature-length drama written by Alan Plater, starring Kevin Whately, Robson Green, Derek Jacobi, Melanie Hill, Trevor Fox and John Woodvine

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team are called to Runcorn, Cheshire, by Karan Waller, who wants to thank her family for all the support they have given her as she battles a brain tumour. Her garden is the smallest the crew has ever tackled, so Alan is determined to make the best possible use of every inch of space. David Domoney builds bespoke seating from slate that also incorporates handy storage, Frances Tophill demonstrates ways of maintaining colour in the garden all year round, and Katie Rushworth helps to create an extra planted area on the roof of the new shed. As an additional challenge, the experts transform Karan's front garden into a welcoming, flower-filled paradise

programme.title: Tales from Northumberland with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor explores the rich history and culture of his home county as he travels by land, sea and air, discovering the role Northumberland has played in shaping modern Britain. He begins by spending a day on the remote Farne Islands a few miles off the coast, meeting the National Trust rangers who look after one of the nation's largest bird colonies. He also returns to the port of Seahouses to reminisce about his childhood holidays

programme.title: Tales from Northumberland with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor ventures off the beaten track to explore the wilderness of the sparsely populated Northumberland National Park. After spending the night in a ramshackle hut, he meets 23-year-old Emma Grey, who has taken on the challenge of running one of the most remote farms in England. He also visits Kielder Observatory, a labour of love for bricklayer-turned-astronomer Gary Fildes

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh heads to Bideford in Devon, where Tamsyn and Alex Wood's lives have been turned upside down in the last three years. Having emigrated to the south of France with their four children, they were forced to return to the UK after Alex suffered a brain injury followed by two haemorrhages. Alan sets his team the challenge of transforming the Woods' garden into a coastal haven, inspired by Alex's passion for surfing and the home's proximity to the sea. David Domoney upcycles a boat to create a bespoke daybed, Katie Rushworth turns old fruit barrels into raised planters and Frances Tophill introduces swathes of hardy flowers mixed in with paths of shingle

With Jake prosecuting, the man's defence barrister tries to prove his vulnerability and mental illness, but then a twist in the investigation leaves Sam's career hanging in the balance.
